page.title: 04Customs.
page.content: Every year on Shrove Tuesday we have Egg Shackling. Sometimes we do it in school and sometimes we go to the Village Hall. Each child brings a fresh, uncooked egg marked clearly with his or her name and all the eggs are put in a big sieve that we borrow from the bakery. Quite often the Rector does the shakling. He shakes all the eggs together and we all listen until we hear a cracking noise. The cracked egg is taken out and the shaking starts again. You go on taking out cracked eggs until there are only three left. These children win a prize -the next one to crack gets third prize and the next one second prize and the last one first prize. We always break the winning egg to show that it is a fresh one! All the eggs are used to make pancakes. It is a very, very old tradition here.
